Detailed Description

Main header file for the magnetometers iron calibration library.

Author:
SBG Systems (Raphael Siryani)
Date:
01/02/10
Main header file for the magnetometers iron calibration library.
In order to use the iron calibration library, please include this file in your project.

Copyright Notice

Copyright (C) 2007-2011, SBG Systems SAS. All rights reserved.

This source code is intended for use only by SBG Systems SAS and those that have explicit written permission to use it from SBG Systems SAS.

THIS CODE AND INFORMATION IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND/OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

Define Documentation

#define SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API

In order to use the library as a DLL one, please define SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_DLL. If not, the library will be used as a static one.

Typedef Documentation

typedef enum _SbgIronCalibQuality SbgIronCalibQuality

Magnetometers calibration quality indicator.

typedef struct _SbgIronCalibResults SbgIronCalibResults

This struct is used to returns the calibration results and quality indicators.

typedef struct _SbgIronCalibHandleInt* SbgIronCalibHandle

Defines the main iron calibration library handle.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum _SbgIronCalibQuality

Magnetometers calibration quality indicator.

Enumerator:
SBG_IRON_CALIB_QUALITY_PERFECT  The magnetometers calibration is perfect allowing a 1 to 2° accuracy.
SBG_IRON_CALIB_QUALITY_GOOD  The device should work corectly but with a degraded accuracy.
SBG_IRON_CALIB_QUALITY_INVALID  The magnetometers calibration isn't good enough to be used.

enum SbgIronCalibMode

Enum used to define the calibration mode (2D or 3D).

Enumerator:
SBG_CALIB_MODE_2D_HORIZONTAL  2D horizontal mode to use only when the device is leveled and rotated arround the Z axis.
SBG_CALIB_MODE_2D  2D mode used only if all magnetometers data are in a plane.
SBG_CALIB_MODE_3D  3D mode default mode that fits almost all applications.

Function Documentation

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibInit ( const char  licenceKey[30],
SbgIronCalibHandle *  pHandle 
)

Create and initialise the iron calibration library.

Parameters:
[in] licenceKey The provided licence key in the form (XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX).
[out] pHandle Pointer on a SbgIronCalibHandle variable that can hold the created handle.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if the library has been initialised.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibClose ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle  ) 

Destroy the iron calibration library.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if a valid iron calibration library handle has been destroyed.

uint32 SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibGetVersion ( void   ) 

Returns an integer representing the version of the iron calibration library.

Returns:
An integer representing the version of the iron calibration library.
Use SBG_VERSION_GET_MAJOR, SBG_VERSION_GET_MINOR, SBG_VERSION_GET_REV and SBG_VERSION_GET_BUILD.

const char SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API* sbgIronCalibGetVersionAsString ( void   ) 

Returns the iron calibration library version as a string (1.0.0.0).

Returns:
Null terminated string that hold the iron calibration library version.

bool SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibGetIsUsingDouble ( void   ) 

Returns if the iron calibration library is using float or double for internal computations.

Returns:
TRUE if the iron calibration library is using double or FALSE otherwise.

char  errorMsg[256] 
)

Convert an error code into a human readable string.

Parameters:
[in] errorCode Our errorCode to convert into a string.
[out] errorMsg String buffer used to hold the error string.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibAddPointsList ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle,
uint8 *  pDataList[12],
uint32  numData 
)

Add a set of points to the list of magnetometers calibration data using the standard 12 bytes format. Each points is stored in a 12 bytes buffer as returned by the serial devices. The sbgCenter also produce .mag files that contains the same type of data.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
[in] pDataList Our list of magnetomters calibration data to add.
[in] numData The number of elements we have in the magnetomters calibration data list.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if we have sucessfully added the points.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibAddPoint ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle,
uint8  magnetometerData[12] 
)

Add a new point to the list of magnetometers calibration datausing the standard 12 bytes format. Each points is stored in a 12 bytes buffer as returned by the serial devices. The sbgCenter also produce .mag files that contains the same type of data.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
[in] magnetometerData Our magnetomter data to add.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if we have sucessfully added the point.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibAddPointsListCAN ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle,
uint8 *  pDataList[6],
uint32  numData 
)

Add a set of points to the list of magnetometers calibration data using the special 6 bytes CAN format. Due to CAN frame specifications, the CAN devices are using a custom 6 bytes format to store magnetometers calibration. Warning: The sbgCenter always produce .mag files that contains the standard 12 bytes format.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
[in] pDataList Our list of magnetomters calibration data to add.
[in] numData The number of elements we have in the magnetomters calibration data list.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if we have sucessfully added the points.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibAddPointCAN ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle,
uint8  magnetometerData[6] 
)

Add a set of points to the list of magnetometers calibration data using the special 6 bytes CAN format. Due to CAN frame specifications, the CAN devices are using a custom 6 bytes format to store magnetometers calibration. Warning: The sbgCenter always produce .mag files that contains the standard 12 bytes format.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
[in] magnetometerData Our magnetomter data to add.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if we have sucessfully added the point.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibReleasePoints ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle  ) 

Remove all magnetometers calibration data that have been added.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if we have successfully released the magnetometers calibration data.

Returns how many magnetometers calibration data we have.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
Returns:
The number of magnetometers calibration data.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibGetCalibratedData ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle,
const SbgIronCalibResults *  pCalibrationResults,
uint32  index,
float  calibratedMag[3] 
)

Given an index in the calibration data list, returns the corresponding calibrated magnetometer value.
sbgIronCalibCompute should have been called before you can use this function.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
[in] pCalibrationResults Pointer to a filled structure SbgIronCalibResults (tipically returned by sbgIronCalibCompute).
[in] index Index of the magnetometers calibration data.
[out] calibratedMag Our X,Y,Z magnetometer calibrated value.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if we are able to compute the calibrated magnetometer data.

SbgErrorCode SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibCompute ( SbgIronCalibHandle  handle,
SbgIronCalibMode  mode,
SbgIronCalibResults *  pCalibrationResults 
)

Computes the calibration data according to the calibration mode.

Parameters:
[in] handle Our iron calibration library handle.
[in] mode Defines if we would like to perform a 2D or 3D calibration.
[out] pCalibrationResults Pointer to a valid structure SbgIronCalibResults that can hold the calibration results.
Returns:
SBG_NO_ERROR if the calibration has been sucessfully computed.

void SBG_IRON_CALIBRATION_API sbgIronCalibInitResultsToZero ( SbgIronCalibResults *  pCalibrationResults  ) 

Initialize a iron calibration results struct to default values.

Parameters:
[in] pCalibrationResults Pointer to a SbgIronCalibResults structure to initialize to zero.
